intro: Rubus × contractifrons, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, which are typically trifoliate or pinnate. The plant produces aggregate fruits, known as drupes, which are edible and have a sweet-tart flavor. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or disturbed soils. Due to its vigorous growth, it can become invasive in certain regions.
